title: Task-Based Turkish as a Second Language Learning: Short-Term Intensive Course in Mathematics Field

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Turkish grammar and conversational proficiency (A2-B1 level), foundational understanding of basic mathematical concepts (fractions, geometry, equations, etc.)
context.additional_context: For mathematics professionals, this course focuses on acquiring Turkish technical terminology applicable to workplace contexts, designed for smartphone-based learning. Learners develop dual abilities: expressing mathematical concepts in Turkish and incorporating peer feedback.

learning_goals: Capable of performing role-plays using 50 daily/work-related Turkish expressions.

Learners can create a 3-minute Turkish-language video explaining a math concept (e.g., fraction calculations, geometry principles, equation solving, graph interpretation), collaborate with team members to submit a project report including the video link and five+ quiz items (with calculation/proof questions) at least three days before the course ends.
Drafting business emails incorporating 30 Turkish academic terms (including math-related vocabulary such as measurement, analysis, probability, statistics) and incorporating feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
